question: The Union Government has amalgamated which of the following Regional Rural Banks (RRBs) into a single RRB?
option1: Punjab Gramin Bank and Sarva UP Gramin Bank
option2: Malwa Gramin Bank and Allahabad UP Gramin Bank
option3: Sarva UP Gramin Bank and Gramin Bank of Aryavart
option4: Punjab Gramin Bank, Malwa Gramin Bank and Sutlej Gramin Bank
answer: Punjab Gramin Bank, Malwa Gramin Bank and Sutlej Gramin Bank
explanation: The Government of India  (GoI) has amalgamated three Regional Rural Banks (RRB) -- Punjab Gramin Bank, Malwa Gramin Bank and Sutlej Gramin Bank -- into a single RRB with effect from January 1. The sponsor banks of the RRBs are National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development (NABARD), the Government of Punjab and Punjab National Bank (PNB), State Bank of India (SBI) and Punjab and Sind Bank.
